message.content:
There can be several reasons why your left elbow hurts when you try to lay down. Here are some potential explanations:

1. Trauma or injury: You may have experienced an injury or trauma without realizing it, such as falling on your arm or bumping it against a hard surface.

2. Tendinitis: This is the inflammation of tendons that attach muscles to bones and can cause pain in the elbow area.

3. Bursitis: Inflammation of bursae, small fluid-filled sacs near joints, can also contribute to elbow pain and discomfort while laying down.

4. Arthritis: If you suffer from osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis, these conditions could lead to pain in the joint area during rest.

5. Nerve compression (Cubital Tunnel Syndrome): The ulnar nerve passes through a tunnel behind the inner part of your elbow called the cubital tunnel; sometimes this nerve becomes compressed due to prolonged bending at the wrist resulting in numbness & tingling sensation along with muscular weakness around fingers which might cause extra strain on elbows leading them susceptible towards experiencing more chronic pains like yours upon lying down

6. Referred Pain: Sometimes pain from other parts of our body manifest within our elbows instead because specific areas share common nerves clusters between multiple regions - examples being neck & shoulder injuries transmitting their painful sensations via cervical spine downwards into arms/elbows/hands etcetera too often causing similar uncomfortable experiences while resting horizontally besides lying asleep as well!

7) Muscle Strain/Tension- Overworking certain muscle groups throughout one day could potentially induce localized soreness about its origin+insertion points; forearm muscles attaching themselves onto medial epicondyle via flexor tendonimus alonis hence explains why when
